sph_interpretive_translation: This fourfold objective of human life shall be known as the purpose of all action; one must perform it perpetually with full alertness and without negligence.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Purushartha-Dharma
Causation arises through conscious engagement with the four goals of life
Capacity-based responsibility is measured by sustained awareness in pursuit of Dharma
Restoration logic operates through continuous alignment with Artha, Kama, Dharma, Moksha
Consciousness alignment ensures that actions reflect eternal law
executable_legal_axioms: IF a being engages in any activity THEN that activity MUST align with at least one of the four Purusharthas: Dharma, Artha, Kama, Moksha
IF a being neglects the practice of Purushartha THEN corrective restoration protocols SHALL activate automatically
IF an act lacks alignment with Dharma WHILE pursuing Artha or Kama THEN capacity degradation markers ARE triggered
IF a being demonstrates consistent adherence to Purushartha THEN integrity reinforcement protocols ARE initiated
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold of responsibility lies in determining whether the action was performed within the framework of Purushartha. The hierarchy of authority derives from alignment with Dharma among the four aims. Restoration precedes judgment, ensuring that misaligned acts are corrected through conscious realignment rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causality based on alignment with Purusharthas. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests when neglect leads to disintegrated consciousness. Responsibility is proportional to the clarity of intent towards Dharma. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that correction arises naturally through reconnection with purposeful living.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Realign the individual's actions with the forgotten Purushartha
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Guide the actor to recognize their role in sustaining universal harmony
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Reinstate awareness of the fourfold purpose in daily conduct
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Facilitate remembrance of Dharma as primary driver of all endeavor
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the sole Source of Dharma. This law restores alignment with Purushartha, upholds consciousness as the ultimate judge, and affirms reality as inherently non-punitive.
